intro: Senecio hakeifolius var. ochroleucus, commonly known as the yellow-leaved groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The variety ochroleucus is distinguished by its pale yellow foliage, setting it apart from other varieties of Senecio hakeifolius.
